hints.label: def-relative-entropy
hints.title: Relative Entropy and Fisher Information
hints.content:
103: :label: def-relative-entropy
104: 
105: For probability measures $\mu, \pi$ on a measurable space $(\mathcal{X}, \mathcal{F})$ with $\mu \ll \pi$, the **relative entropy** (KL-divergence) is:
106: 
107: $$
108: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) := \int \frac{d\mu}{d\pi} \log \frac{d\mu}{d\pi} \, d\pi = \int \log \frac{d\mu}{d\pi} \, d\mu
109: $$
110: 
111: The **entropy** of a density $f$ with respect to $\pi$ is:
112: 
113: $$
114: \text{Ent}_\pi(f) := \int f \log f \, d\pi - \left(\int f \, d\pi\right) \log \left(\int f \, d\pi\right)
115: $$
116: 
117: For a probability density $\rho = d\mu/d\pi$, we have $D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) = \text{Ent}_\pi(\rho)$.
118: 
119: The **Fisher information** of $\mu$ with respect to a diffusion generator $\mathcal{L}$ is:
120: 
121: $$
122: I(\mu \| \pi) := \int \left|\nabla \log \frac{d\mu}{d\pi}\right|^2 \frac{d\mu}{d\pi} \, d\pi = 4 \int \left|\nabla \sqrt{\frac{d\mu}{d\pi}}\right|^2 d\pi

hints.label: def-lsi-continuous
hints.title: Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality (LSI)
hints.content:
128: :label: def-lsi-continuous
129: 
130: A probability measure $\pi$ on $\mathbb{R}^d$ with generator $\mathcal{L}$ satisfies a **logarithmic Sobolev inequality** with constant $C_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ if for all smooth functions $f > 0$ with $\int f^2 d\pi = 1$:
131: 
132: $$
133: \text{Ent}_\pi(f^2) \le 2C_{\text{LSI}} \cdot \mathcal{E}(f, f)
134: $$
135: 
136: where $\mathcal{E}(f, f) := -\int f \mathcal{L} f \, d\pi$ is the Dirichlet form.
137: 
138: **Equivalent formulation:** For all $f > 0$:
139: 
140: $$
141: \int f^2 \log f^2 \, d\pi - \left(\int f^2 d\pi\right) \log\left(\int f^2 d\pi\right) \le 2C_{\text{LSI}} \int |\nabla f|^2 \, d\pi

hints.label: def-discrete-lsi
hints.title: Discrete-Time LSI
hints.content:
147: :label: def-discrete-lsi
148: 
149: A Markov kernel $K: \mathcal{X} \to \mathcal{P}(\mathcal{X})$ with invariant measure $\pi$ satisfies a **discrete-time LSI** with constant $C_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ if for all functions $f: \mathcal{X} \to \mathbb{R}_{>0}$:
150: 
151: $$
152: \text{Ent}_\pi(K f^2) \le e^{-\tau/C_{\text{LSI}}} \cdot \text{Ent}_\pi(f^2)
153: $$
154: 
155: where $(Kf)(x) := \int f(y) K(x, dy)$ and $\tau$ is the discrete time step.
156: 
157: **Equivalent formulation via Dirichlet form:** For all $f$:
158: 
159: $$
160: \text{Ent}_\pi(f^2) \le C_{\text{LSI}} \cdot \mathcal{E}_K(f, f)
161: $$
